text: Merthyr Tydfil railway station () is a train station in Merthyr Tydfil, a town in Wales. It opened in 1853. Managed by Transport for Wales, it is the northern end of the Merthyr line that connects it to Cardiff Central. It is a small station and only has one platform. ==Services== The station has a train every half hour to and from Cardiff Central on weekdays and Saturdays. Trains to Cardiff usually continue past the city and end at Barry Island or Bridgend. ==Gallery== File:04.04.86_Merthyr_Tydfil_Class_116_set_C318_(6924741422).jpg|The station in 1986 File:Merthyr Tydfil railway station in 2009.jpg|A train at the station Category:19th-century establishments in Wales Category:1853 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:Railway stations in Wales
